means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 霍尔地貌名称，来源于古英语，含义是“洞穴，洼地”(hole,hollow,depression,lowlying spot)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"洞，穴"之意。
means: hole ： 最普通用词，泛指实体上的洞、孔或坑，不涉及其大小、深浅或穿透与否。
cave ： 指出洞、窑洞或溶洞，可以是天然的或人造的。
cavity比hole正式，指实体内中或表面的空洞或空腔。
hollow ： 通常指表面上的坑或凹处，也指物体内部的空洞。
pit ： 指天然的大洞，尤指地上的洞，也指为采掘矿物而挖的深洞。

word_mean: 系统中的安全缺陷。漏洞可以导致入侵者获取信息并导致不正确的访问。

sentence.Network_en: He admitted that the government was in "a dreadful hole".

sentence.Network_en: Dig a largish hole and bang the stake in first.
sentence.Network_cn: 挖一个大点儿的洞，先把木桩敲进去。

sentence.Network_en: A plug had been inserted in the drill hole.

(Cricket)(of a batsman) hit the ball to a fielder and be caught

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hol (noun), holian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hol (noun) 'cave', (adjective) 'hollow', and German hohl 'hollow', from an Indo-European root meaning 'cover, conceal'

entry.def: A hole is a hollow space in something solid, with an opening on one side.

example.ex: He took a shovel, dug a hole, and buried his once-prized possessions...
example.tran: 他拿起一把铁锨，挖了个坑，将自己曾经珍爱的物品埋了起来。

example.ex: The builders had cut holes into the soft stone to support the ends of the beams.
example.tran: 建筑工人在软石上挖了洞以支撑梁端。

entry.def: A hole is an opening in something that goes right through it.

example.ex: These tiresome creatures eat holes in the leaves...
example.tran: 这些讨厌的虫子在叶子上咬出了洞。

example.ex: Armed robbers broke into the jeweller's through a hole in the wall.
example.tran: 持枪劫匪钻过墙洞闯进了珠宝店。

entry.def: A hole is the home or hiding place of a mouse, rabbit, or other small animal.

entry.tran: （法律、理论、论点等的）漏洞，缺陷，破绽
entry.def: A hole in a law, theory, or argument is a fault or weakness that it has.

example.ex: There were some holes in that theory, some unanswered questions.
example.tran: 那个理论中有一些漏洞，一些问题没有解答。

entry.def: If you refer to a place as a hole, you are emphasizing that you think it is very unpleasant.

example.ex: Why don't you leave this awful hole and come to live with me?
example.tran: 你为什么不离开这个破地方，搬过来和我住？

entry.tran: （9洞或18洞高尔夫球场的）球洞（指从球座到球穴的一段区域）
entry.def: A hole is also one of the nine or eighteen sections of a golf course.

example.ex: I played nine holes with Gary Player today.
example.tran: 我今天和加里·普莱耶打了9洞高尔夫球。

entry.def: A hole is one of the places on a golf course that the ball must drop into, usually marked by a flag.
If you hole in a game of golf, you hit the ball so that it goes into the hole.

example.ex: He holed from nine feet at the 18th...
example.tran: 他打到第18洞时从9英尺外击球入穴。

example.ex: Frost holed a bunker shot from 50 feet to snatch the title by one stroke.
example.tran: 弗罗斯特在50英尺外的沙坑中击球入穴，以一杆的优势获得冠军。

entry.tran: 打出破洞于，炸出窟窿于（建筑物、船只等上）
entry.def: If something such as a building or ship is holed, holes are made in it by guns or other weapons.

example.ex: Blocks of flats have been holed and some shells have fallen within the historic ramparts.
example.tran: 几栋公寓楼被炸出了窟窿，几枚炮弹还落在了古护城墙内。

entry.def: If you say that you need something or someone like a hole in the head, you are emphasizing that you do not want them and that they would only add to the problems that you already have.

example.ex: We need more folk heroes like we need a hole in the head.
example.tran: 我们绝对不需要有更多的民间英雄了。

entry.def: If you say that you are in a hole, you mean that you are in a difficult or embarrassing situation.

example.ex: He admitted that the government was in 'a dreadful hole'.
example.tran: 他承认政府目前“处境极为尴尬”。

entry.tran: （高尔夫球运动中从发球区的）一杆入穴
entry.def: If you get a hole in one in golf, you get the golf ball into the hole with a single stroke.

example.ex: All they ever dream about is getting a hole in one.
example.tran: 他们一直梦想着能一杆入穴。

entry.tran: 在（论点或理论）中挑毛病
entry.def: If you pick holes in an argument or theory, you find weak points in it so that it is no longer valid.

example.ex: He then goes on to pick holes in the article before reaching his conclusion.
example.tran: 他接着在文章中挑了一番刺儿后才作出结论。

means.word_mean: 1. an opening into or through something
2. an opening deliberately made in or through something
3. one playing period (from tee to green) on a golf course;
5. a depression hollowed out of solid matter
7. informal terms for a difficult situation;

sentences.sentence: "he made a muddle of his marriage"

means.word_mean: 1. hit the ball into the hole

list.explanation: 秘藏的王牌，秘而不露的髙招

example.en: The lawyer's ace in the hole was a secret witness who had seen the accident.
example.zh: 那律师手中的王牌是一个目睹那次事件的秘密人证。

example.en: Shut your puke hole and listen to what I am telling you!
example.zh: 闭上你的臭嘴，好好听着我在对你说的话!

example.en: Carl spends almost every evening at the local puke hole.
example.zh: 卡尔差不多天天晚上都泡在当地的那家小酒馆里。

example.en: Who didn't flush the puke hole?

list.explanation: 酒吧,小酒馆，(夜总会等的)卖酒处

example.en: Now this place is one of my favorite water hole.
example.zh: 现在这地方是我最喜欢的酒吧之一。

example.en: I think you live down at that watering hole.
example.zh: 我看你在那家小酒馆里是把一切都忘了。
